data.title: My go-to lunch spot for soup & sandwiches
data.text: If it's a rainy day, cold day, or just a day that I'm craving a soup and sandwich for lunch, then I head to Walton Way Deli. The owner makes four different soups from scratch every day - three soups rotate but they always have their signature Brunswick Stew. I haven't had a soup yet that I didn't like. Add a grilled cheese or pimento cheese sandwich and you've got the perfect lunch combo. Service is fast, so even if you don't have much time you can get in and out pretty quickly. Or you can order in advance and pick it up to take with you.

data.title: Could not be better
data.text: I very rarely order items straight from the menu, I am one who wants my way...right since I'm paying for and eating it.  Well that does not present any problems with the people @ Walton Way Deli. They are very courteous and prompt with my orders, besides the quality/portions of items are scrumptious and worth the $$, imparting the 'old way' of satisfying the customer leaves a greater method of satisfaction than any other.  They are open Monday Thru Friday ONLY - - - BUT you don't want to ruin a good thing by having too much all week long.  I might be sorry in reviewing Walton Way Deli that too many people will overrun the Deli, BUT that will not phase the owners one single bit as I am sure they will maintain the excellent service and food quality regardless

data.title: I don't get the hype...
data.text: People speak of this place like it's some sort of icon in the medical district in Augusta. Some swear by it and go there at least once a week. I've been there twice now, and I just don't get it. My visits were a few years apart, but I came to the same conclusion both times. For the money you can do much better, and even much closer to the hospitals if that's where you're coming from. Today I ordered a Philly Steak & Cheese sandwich, fries and a regular drink. It was over 10 bucks for that for a sandwich that came on a bun not much bigger than a hot dog bun. The fries were hot and fresh, but nothing special by any means. The steak in the sandwich was more like thinly sliced roast beef and just had no flavor at all. For the same money I can go to Firehouse up the street and get a large steak and cheese (twice the sandwich and 3x the flavor), chips and a drink twice the size of the one I got here for right at the same price. I'll stick with that next time.

data.title: Wasn't impressed
data.text: My Reuben had barely any meat and was very salty. I wasn't a fan of the potatoe salad either. The fries weren't bad.

data.title: Great sandwiches
data.text: A very great local deli to grab a quick sandwich. They have so many different types of sandwiches that you can definitely find one for you. I eat at this place nearly every week. Service is quick and very friendly.

data.title: Excellent veggie burgers and onion rings
data.text: My daughter and I ate lunch here.  I had the curry veggie burger and onion rings.  My daughter had a cheese and croissant sandwich and potato soup.  I loved my lunch.  The coating stayed on the onion rings, which were hot, crispy and delicious.  My curried veggie burger was tasty.  They offered several different flavored burgers, nice to have some meatless options when eating out.

data.title: Yummiest Veggie Burger in Augusta, Georgia
data.text:
The curry veggie burger is by far the tastiest (messiest) burger in the area for vegetarians. It's the better choice of fast food when eating close to downtown Augusta. The fries are seasoned with paprika among among items, which reminds me of the fries I used to eat fro the Schnellimbiß in Germany. Everyone who works there is wonderfully friendly. 

A call-in order is almost always ready when you arrive. The downside is that you should get there fairly early if you want to eat there...seating is quite limited. (that is the reasoning behind the four out of five stars)
